definition: all black, no daylight (idiom); a world without justice
to close (a door)/to eclipse/muddled/stupid/ignorant/variant of 暗[an4]
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

sentences.english: Writing, is to complete darkness to suicide.
sentences.chinese: 写作，是以场暗无天日的自杀。

sentences.english: Like a complete darkness feelings, the end of not half sunshine.
sentences.chinese: 就像一段暗无天日的感情，终见不得半分阳光。

sentences.english: This means that the far side of the planet is constantly in darkness.
sentences.chinese: 这也意味着它的另一面永远暗无天日。

sentences.english: These years that I have been in love have been the darkest days of my life.
sentences.chinese: 这些被爱情左右的岁月，是我人生最暗无天日的日子。

sentences.english: The narrow streets were darkened with the high towers of the nobles.
sentences.chinese: 这些狭窄的街巷被贵族家庭的高塔遮得暗无天日。

sentences.english: The old society was an abyss of darkness.

definition: all black, no daylight (idiom); a world without justice
to lose all interest in life (idiom)
a day drags past like a year (idiom); time hangs heavy/time crawls when one is wretched
cage/trap (e.g. basket, pit or snare for catching animals)/fig. bonds (of wrong ideas)/shackles (of past misconceptions)/to trap/to shackle
deep water and scorching fire/abyss of suffering (idiom)
cage used to hold or transport prisoners

pinyin: shen1 shou3 bu4 jian4 wu3 zhi3

definition: at dawn, not sure of lasting to evening (idiom); precarious state/imminent crisis/living from hand to mouth
hell on earth (idiom); suffering the torments of Buddhist hell while still alive/fig. having an uncomfortable time
